relation: Creates an ISG control class map.
Specifies a control class for which actions may be configured in an ISG control policy map.
Creates or modifies a control policy map, which defines an ISG control policy.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Intelligent Services Gateway Command Reference - M through Z [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1823=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS XE Release 2.1 and implemented on Cisco ASR 1000 series routers., 23199=(Optional) Normal burst size, in bytes. TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {862052=(Optional) Maximum number of subscriber session traces that can be stored in the history log buffer. Range: 10 to 1000. Default: 100., 808791=This command was introduced on the ASR 1000 Series Routers., 807390=The default value is 1000 milliseconds., 57888=The following example specifies port 1650 as the port on which the device listens for RADIUS requests:, 896101=This command was modified. The maximum value of the duration-in-seconds argument was increased from 4294967 seconds to 15552000 seconds., 54701=Port number. The default value is port 1700., 157838=This command can be configured only once under any traffic class service on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router., 159273=The following example configures ISG to redirect all traffic coming from the subscriber interface to 2001:DB8:C003:12::2918 port 80:, 892687=Number of seconds a subscriber session can be idle before it is terminated. Range: n to 15552000. The minimum value is platform and release-specific. For more information, use the question mark (?) online help function., 90994=Specifies the MAC address in a one-byte format (00.00.40.96.3e.4a)., 837507=(Optional) Interval, in minutes, for the periodic update. Range: 10 to 1044. Default: 15., 846983=The following example shows how to configure 2000 sessions to be synchronized per second during bulk and dynamic synchronization:, 158881=The following example configures ISG to redirect all traffic coming from the subscriber interface to 10.2.36.253. The destination port is left unchanged, so traffic to 10.10.10.10 port 23 is redirected to 10.2.36.253 port 23, and traffic to 10.4.4.4 port 80 is redirected to 10.2.36.253 port 80., 244=For QoS class maps on Cisco 7600 series routers, the limits are 1024 class maps and 256 classes in a policy map., 92576=Specifies dot (.) as the delimiter in the MAC address (00.00.40.96.3e.4a).}

To remove filter match criteria, use the no form of this command. match (radius-filter) trust timer (ISG RADIUS proxy) timeout idle timeout absolute (ISG) threshold (ISG) test sgi xml subscriber trace history subscriber trace event subscriber redundancy subscriber policy recording subscriber feature prepaid subscriber accounting ssg subscriber accounting accuracy source show tech-support subscriber show subscriber trace statistics show subscriber trace history show subscriber trace statistics show subscriber statistics show subscriber session show subscriber service show subscriber policy peer show subscriber policy dpm statistics show subscriber default-session show ssm
textAfterTable: Command Default Filter match criteria are not configured. Command Modes RADIUS filter configuration (config-radius-filter)        Command History Release Modification Cisco IOS XE Release 3.5S This command was introduced. Usage Guidelines Use the match command to check for the attribute to be present in the packet. The vendor-type and ven-type-number keyword-argument pair specifies the attributes associated with a specific vendor. If no attribute is specified, the condition matches the filter for any attribute of the specific vendor: Examples The following example shows how to enter the RADIUS filter configuration mode and configure a match attribute and a vendor type. Device(config)# radius filter match-all filter1 Device (config-radius-filter) match vendor-type 15 attribute 45 Related Commands
